text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello i am sindhuja a cloud support
engineer here at aws office in bangalore
today i'm going to show you how you can
create a separate hosted zone for sub
domain and route internet traffic to it
by performing sub domain delegation
through name servers and amazon drought
53 let's get started before creating a
sub domain keep the following
prerequisites in mind
a valid registered domain regardless of
the registrar
and a valid hosted zone for the
registered domain apex domain in route
53 if your setup meets these conditions
then you are ready to create a hosted
zone with the same name as the sub
domain that you want to route traffic
for such as
www.networkmark.com
to do this
log into the aws management console and
navigate to the rav53 console
in the navigation pane
choose hosted zones
choose create hosted zoom
in the right pane enter the name of the
sub domain such as www.networkmonk.com
for type accept the default value of
public hosted zone
choose create hosted zone
after creating the hosted zone for the
sub domain expand the hosted zone
details drop down list for the sub
domain in the hosted zone
www.networkmoc.com
in the right pane
copy the names of the four servers
listed as the name servers under hosted
zone details
finally add ns records in apex domains
hosted zone to perform delegation
between your apex and subdomain
select the hosted zone for the domain
networkmark.com be sure not to select
the name of the sub domain that is
www.networkmark.com
in the hosted zone for the domain
choose create record for name enter the
name of the sub domain for value enter
the names of the name servers which were
previously copied from sub domain posted
zone details
for record time choose ennis name
servers for a hosted zone
for ttl seconds
select a more common value for an ns
record such as 172 800 seconds
for route policy choose simple routing
choose create records
note that the previous steps also apply
for cross account scenarios where the
hosted zone for the domain and the sub
domain are in different accounts
so now you know how to create sub domain
for the domain hosted in amazon route 53
and route traffic to it successfully
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
